turkey.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a bird that looks like a large chicken and is often eaten at Christmas and at Thanksgiving
turkey.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the meat from a turkey eaten as food
turkey.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a country which is mainly in west Asia but partly in southeast Europe, between the Mediterranean and Black Seas. Population: 80,694,485 (2014). Capital: Ankara. Until the early 20th century, Turkey was the centre of the large Ottoman Empire, whose capital city was Istanbul, Turkeyâ€™s largest city. It became a republic in 1923, and its first president was Kemal Ataturk, who made great changes to make Turkey a more modern country. Turkey is a member of NATO and has asked to become a member of the EU.
